communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Personnel records limited to all training and professional development received by the following LBPD investigators:

- D. Goodman #5311
- S. Lasch #5451
- P. Lyon #5889
- B. Anguiano #5945

Please limit these records to training received between January 1, 2009 and January 1, 2014, to include records of training received through CA POST ICI, private training companies, conferences, or other training provider not listed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christa Miller

title: SOP, Special Orders, Training etc. for Investigations

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All records of standard operating procedures, special orders, rescinded special orders, directives, memoranda, and protocols 
- All training delivered to investigative personnel, including email, training documents, slide presentations, and other training documents

Pertaining to the following:

- Interviews of subjects with traumatic brain injuries (TBIs), mental illnesses, and/or impairment due to drug and/or alcohol use
- Cellular phone consent searches
- Call detail records requests
- Video surveillance camera evidence collection
- Social media investigations

Please limit these records to those in effect for the period ranging November 1, 2011 through December 31, 2013.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christa Miller
